title: Arnhem Land (A)
creator_contributor_role: Australian National Film Board, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Rites and ceremonies
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Exploring expeditions

description: Records the 1948 joint Australian-American expedition to Arnhem Land. Shows field work of scientists collecting specimens of insects, birds, fish, mammals, flowers, vegetation, rock structures, aboriginal paintings and carvings, etc. Several scenes show aborigines in ceremonial rituals, including the dances of the great kangaroo, the water snake, and the wild honey dances. Photographed by Peter Bassett-Smith, with music by Alfred F. Hill.
